intro: Codonoboea glabrata, commonly known as the smooth codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
